p: Herpes zoster (HZ), often referred to as shingles or zona, is a kind of viral disease characterized by painful rashes with blisters in a limited area on one side of the body, usually in the form of streaks. Initial infection with varicella zoster virus (VZV) can cause acute illness (chickenpox), usually in children and young adults. HZ is a reactivation of the latent varicella zoster virus infection, which can lead to a large incidence, especially in the elderly and patients with impaired immune function ( 1).
